sentences.en: Chardonnay berries are relatively small, thin - skinned, fragile , and oxidize easily.
sentences.cn: 霞多利的果实很小, 但果皮很厚, 且易破裂, 易氧化.

sentences.en: Ensure the area is dark. Bright light will oxidize wine.
sentences.cn: 确保存酒的地方是黑暗的. 亮光会氧化葡萄酒.

sentences.en: If the organic material decays or is oxidized, it will not form petroleum.
sentences.cn: 如果有机物腐烂或氧化，它不会形成石油。

sentences.en: In addition, argon plasma will not oxidize silver unlike an air or oxygen plasma.
sentences.cn: 此外, 氩气等离子体不会像大气或氧气等离子体氧化银.

sentences.en: Increase the cell the activity and have the cell repair maintenance and anti - to oxidize the function.
sentences.cn: 增加细胞活性并具有细胞修护及抗氧化功能.

sentences.en: Metallurgy To heat ( ores ) in a furnace in order to dehydrate, purify, or oxidize before smelting.
sentences.cn: 煅烧 ( 矿石):为在熔化前脱去水份 、 提纯或氧化而在熔炉里焙烧(矿石 )

sentences.en: The article introduces the performance and application of oxidize starch.
sentences.cn: 介绍了氧化淀粉的性质,性能及其应用.

sentences.en: The carbon14 atoms oxidize to carbon dioxide which gets blown about and mixed up with lower atmosphere.
sentences.cn: 碳14原子氧化生成二氧化碳，向四周散去并与低空的大气混合。

sentences.en: The dye is to oxidize before the next dip.
sentences.cn: 染料允许在下个垂度之前氧化.

trans.tran_en: to combine with oxygen, or make something combine with oxygen, especially in a way that causes rust
